alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Marion; Walker; Winston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 1:14AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Fayette, Marion, Walker and Winston. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 114 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winfield, Haleyville, Carbon Hill, Lynn, Arley, Guin, Double Springs, Brilliant, Addison, Glen Allen, Kansas, Nauvoo, Gu- Win, Eldridge, Ashbank, Winston Free State Barn, Houston Recreational Area, Poplar Springs, Camp McDowell and Ashridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
